page.title: 03Farming in Stevington
page.content: Of the seven farms in Stevington four are solely arable.One farm combines growing barley and wheat with the rearing of beef cattle,having at this moment sixty Charolais cows.There is a herd of fifty-four Aberdeen Angus beef cattle and thirty-five ewes plus ram on another smaller farm.The greatest variety in the farming line is carried on by the only pig breeder in the village.As of now the pig unit consists of thirty breeding sows and their piglets and gilts making up two hundred and ten animals in all.As well as wheat and barley this farmer goes in for market gardening,growing crops of brussels sprouts,runner beans, leeks,sprouting broccoli and potatoes. Three farmers from neighbouring villages also own fairly small amounts of land in Stevington.
